Tucson narrows his optics.  A bit un nerved, but not frightened enough to t=
urn back and run. Instead, he would press on, and while doing so, while hol=
ding Vestige in one arm, as his strength could allow him, with the other ar=
m, he reaches for a spare emergency canister of energon which he had saved =
for dire need.  This was that dire need.  He opens it, and holds it for Ves=
tige to drink from it.

" I don't know where we can find a repair chamber, =
but this should help you find just a little bit more energy.  It's my last =
reserve, but you need this more than I do.  Here, drink, it's energon, and =
it will help you keep some energy in your body."  

At the same time, Tucso=
n was keeping an ear out for the metallic spiders and insects.  His pace st=
eady, as he continues to walk forward, keeping his headlights a blaze to li=
ght his way.

"We'll get through this Vestige, I promise you."

--- In nbwr=
pg@yahoogroups.com, Preston Carroll <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
>
> > <OLD>
=
> >
> > Tucson holds Vestige and bravely walks out of the car, and
> > towa=
rd the sound of Rodimus's voice.
> >
> > "I'M HERE RODIMUS, KEEP CALLING TO=
 ME, I'LL FIND YOU! IF
> > YOUR EYES HAVE FAILED YOU, REMEMBER, YOU STILL H=
AVE
> > YOUR OTHER SENSES!"
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> There was no answer comming fro=
m Rodimus save for the sound of buzzing
> insects, there were near and appr=
oaching as Tuscon moved as best he
> could along the corridores and tunnels=
.
> 
> The area here was built like any transit system he was familiar with=
,
> with long corridores, and signs clearly showing the directions to get
>=
 to one place or another. However it would seem that the lack of
> maintain=
ance was taking its toll as in some places the lights were dim
> or shut of=
f completely due to lack of power or quite simply the bulbs
> had blown out=
.
> 
> 
> > <OLD>
> >
> > While in the darkness of the tunnels, Tucson coul=
d hear a faint voice recalling Perceptor's words which were typed in on the=
 computer. He knew he had to send a message back to Perceptor to let him kn=
ow that he was still all right, and well on his way to finding Rodimus. So =
he looks ahead, and wispers his reply which can also be heard in the lab.
>=
 >
> > " I will find him and I will bring him to saftey. No Autobot abandon=
s his comrades."
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> In the tunnels ahead Tuscon is able to fin=
d a communication link as
> they are seemingly spread out for convientient =
use of all who need it,
> or atleast it would be convienient if there was s=
omeone around to
> actually use it.
> 
> However as Tuscon closed the line =
he could hear the sound of matallic
> scraping sounding very much the same =
as the sound the spider like
> insects made that he had met on the street. =
The sound was comming from
> further up the hall. The echo and reverb along=
 the corridores made it
> it difficult to locate true positioning, but one =
thing was for certain
> it was getting louder, they were closing quickly on=
 his location.
> 
> In his arms Vestige coughed, it would seem that he was =
taking a turn
> for the worst. he would need time in a repair chamber.
> 
>=
